methods.name: createIntentChooser
methods.summary: Creates an activity chooser intent, used to allow the user to select a target activity for an intent.
methods.description:
Use this method when the user wants to take an action that could use any one of a number of applications. For example, when sending a plain text message, the user may choose to send a text message, send an email, or post to a social network.

You pass in an Titanium.Android.Intent representing the action being taken, and a title for the chooser.

The method returns another intent, representing the chooser, which can be used to start an activity. See the code example for details on how to display the chooser.

For more information, see the official Android documentation for Intent.ACTION_CHOOSER
methods.examples:
# Examples

# Using a Chooser

The following example uses an activity chooser to send a plain text message.

var intent = Ti.Android.createIntent( {
    action: Ti.Android.ACTION_SEND,
    type: 'text/plain'
});
intent.putExtra(Ti.Android.EXTRA_SUBJECT, 'This is the subject.');
intent.putExtra(Ti.Android.EXTRA_TEXT, 'This is some text to send.')

var chooser = Ti.Android.createIntentChooser(intent, 'Send Message');
var activity = Ti.Android.currentActivity.startActivity(chooser);

parameters.name: intent
parameters.summary: The intent to display a chooser for.

parameters.name: title
parameters.summary: Title to display on the chooser.

methods.name: createService
methods.summary: Create a Titanium.Android.Service so you can start/stop it and listen for events from it.

parameters.name: intent
parameters.summary:
An `Intent` created with [createServiceIntent](Titanium.Android.createServiceIntent),
which specifies the service to be instantiated.

methods.name: createServiceIntent
methods.summary: Create an Intent to be used to start a service.

parameters.name: options
parameters.summary: Options for the Service.

methods.name: hasPermission
methods.summary: Returns true if the app has permission access.

parameters.name: permission
parameters.summary:
The permission to check for access. This can be any of the constants listed here
with dangerous protection level [here](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission.html).
For example, `android.permission.WRITE_CONTACTS`. 

Since Titanium 6.1.0, the method will also accept `Array<String>`

parameters.name: intent
parameters.summary:
An `Intent` created with [createServiceIntent](Titanium.Android.createServiceIntent),
which specifies the service to check.

methods.name: registerBroadcastReceiver
methods.summary: Registers broadcast receiver for the given actions.

parameters.name: broadcastReceiver
parameters.summary: The broadcast receiver to register and handle the broadcast.

parameters.name: actions
parameters.summary: The actions that the broadcast reciever will handle

parameters.name: permissions
parameters.summary:
The permission(s) to request for access. This can be any of the constants listed here
with dangerous protection level [here](https://developer.android.com/reference/android/Manifest.permission.html).
Normal protection permissions are automatically enabled if they are included in the manifest. An example of a 
dangerous protection permission would be `android.permission.WRITE_CONTACTS`.
The requested permission(s) MUST also be included in the Android Manifest.

Besides this, there are also requestPermission methods that are ready for commonly used situations. These methods are
<Titanium.Calendar.requestCalendarPermissions>, <Titanium.Contacts.requestContactsPermissions>,
<Titanium.Filesystem.requestStoragePermissions>, <Titanium.Geolocation.requestLocationPermissions> and <Titanium.Media.requestCameraPermissions>.

Since Titanium 6.1.0, the method will also accept a String. Any requests where permissions are already granted will yield a successful callback.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.summary: Function to call upon user decision to grant access.

parameters.name: intent
parameters.summary:
An `Intent` created with [createServiceIntent](Titanium.Android.createServiceIntent),
which specifies the service to start.

methods.name: stopService
methods.summary: Stop a simple service that was started with startService.

parameters.name: intent
parameters.summary:
An `Intent` created with [createServiceIntent](Titanium.Android.createServiceIntent),
which specifies the service to stop.

parameters.name: broadcastReceiver
parameters.summary: The broadcast receiver to unregister.

The application needs to also set the android.permission.RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETED permission in the Android manifest section of the tiapp.xml file.

<ti:app>
    <android>
        <manifest>
            <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.RECEIVE_BOOT_COMPLETED"/>
        </manifest>
    </android>
</ti:app>

See Intent.ACTION_BOOT_COMPLETED in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: EXTRA_ALARM_COUNT

constants.description: See Intent.EXTRA_ALARM_COUNT in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: EXTRA_BCC
constants.summary: String array containing e-mail addresses for blind carbon copying.
constants.description: See Intent.EXTRA_BCC in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: EXTRA_CC
constants.summary: String array containing e-mail addresses for carbon copying.
constants.description: See Intent.EXTRA_CC in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: EXTRA_DATA_REMOVED
constants.summary: Boolean indicating full uninstall (true) or partial uninstall (false).

Sent with the Titanium.Android.ACTION_PACKAGE_REMOVED broadcast.

See Intent.EXTRA_DATA_REMOVED in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: EXTRA_DONT_KILL_APP
constants.summary: Boolean indicating to restart the application or not.

Sent with the Titanium.Android.ACTION_PACKAGE_REMOVED and Titanium.Android.ACTION_PACKAGE_CHANGED broadcasts.

constants.name: EXTRA_EMAIL
constants.summary: String array containing e-mail addresses.
constants.description: See Intent.EXTRA_EMAIL in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: EXTRA_INTENT

See Intent.EXTRA_INTENT in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: EXTRA_KEY_EVENT
constants.summary: A KeyEvent object containing the event that triggered the creation of the Intent it is in.
constants.description: See Intent.EXTRA_KEY_EVENT in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: EXTRA_PHONE_NUMBER
constants.summary: String holding the phone number to call or number that was called.
constants.description:
Sent with the Titanium.Android.ACTION_NEW_OUTGOING_CALL broadcast.

Set if the Intent's action is Titanium.Android.ACTION_CALL.

constants.name: EXTRA_REPLACING
constants.summary: Boolean indicating if the package is being replaced.

Sent with the Titanium.Android.ACTION_PACKAGE_REMOVED broadcast.

See Intent.EXTRA_REPLACING in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: EXTRA_SHORTCUT_ICON

constants.name: EXTRA_SHORTCUT_ICON_RESOURCE
constants.summary: Resource of the shortcut.

constants.name: FLAG_ACTIVITY_BROUGHT_TO_FRONT
constants.summary: If activity is already running, bring it to the foreground.
constants.description:
Set by the system when launching a task.

See Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_BROUGHT_TO_FRONT in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_ACTIVITY_CLEAR_TOP
constants.summary: If the activity is present, removes any activities on top of it to make it the foreground activity.
constants.description:
Bitwise-OR the constant with the Intent's flags property.

See Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_CLEAR_TOP in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_ACTIVITY_CLEAR_WHEN_TASK_RESET
constants.summary: Corresponds to the Android Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_CLEAR_WHEN_TASK_RESET constant.
constants.description: See Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_CLEAR_WHEN_TASK_RESET in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_ACTIVITY_EXCLUDE_FROM_RECENTS
constants.summary: Exclude the activity from recently launched activities.
constants.description:
Bitwise-OR the constant with the Intent's flags property.

See Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_EXCLUDE_FROM_RECENTS in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_ACTIVITY_FORWARD_RESULT
constants.summary: Return result to the original calling activity.
constants.description:
Bitwise-OR the constant with the Intent's flags property.

See Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_FORWARD_RESULT in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_ACTIVITY_LAUNCHED_FROM_HISTORY
constants.summary: Activity was launched from history.
constants.description:
Set by the system when launching a task.

See Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_LAUNCHED_FROM_HISTORY in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_ACTIVITY_MULTIPLE_TASK
constants.summary: Start the activity as a new task even if it exists.
constants.description:
Must be used with the Titanium.Android.FLAG_ACTIVITY_NEW_TASK.

Bitwise-OR the constant with the Intent's flags property.

See Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_MULTIPLE_TASK in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_ACTIVITY_NEW_TASK
constants.summary: Activity will be the start of a new task (collection of activities).
constants.description:
Bitwise-OR the constant with the Intent's flags property.

See Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_NEW_TASK in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_ACTIVITY_NO_ANIMATION
constants.summary: Prevent transition animation.
constants.description:
Bitwise-OR the constant with the Intent's flags property.

See Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_NO_ANIMATION in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_ACTIVITY_NO_HISTORY
constants.summary: Do not keep the activity in the history stack.
constants.description:
Bitwise-OR the constant with the Intent's flags property.

See Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_NO_HISTORY in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_ACTIVITY_NO_USER_ACTION
constants.summary: Disables the onUserLeaveHint() callback.
constants.description:
Bitwise-OR the constant with the Intent's flags property.

See Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_NO_USER_ACTION in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_ACTIVITY_PREVIOUS_IS_TOP
constants.summary: Corresponds to the Android Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_PREVIOUS_IS_TOP constant.
constants.description:
Bitwise-OR the constant with the Intent's flags property.

See Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_PREVIOUS_IS_TOP in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_ACTIVITY_REORDER_TO_FRONT
constants.summary: If the activity already exists, place it at the top of the history stack.
constants.description:
Bitwise-OR the constant with the Intent's flags property.

See Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_REORDER_TO_FRONT in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_ACTIVITY_RESET_TASK_IF_NEEDED
constants.summary: If the task already exists, resets the task to its initial state.
constants.description:
Bitwise-OR the constant with the Intent's flags property.

See Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_RESET_TASK_IF_NEEDED in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_ACTIVITY_SINGLE_TOP
constants.summary: Do not launch the activity if it is already running.
constants.description:
Bitwise-OR the constant with the Intent's flags property.

See Intent.FLAG_ACTIVITY_SINGLE_TOP in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_AUTO_CANCEL
constants.summary: Cancel the notification when it is clicked by the user.
constants.description:
Use with flags.

See also: Notification.FLAG_AUTO_CANCEL in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_CANCEL_CURRENT
constants.summary: Cancel the current pending intent before creating a new one.
constants.description:
Use with the flags property.

See PendingIntent.FLAG_CANCEL_CURRENT in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_DEBUG_LOG_RESOLUTION
constants.summary: Enable a log message to print out the resolution of the intent.
constants.description:
Bitwise-OR the constant with the Intent's flags property.

See Intent.FLAG_DEBUG_LOG_RESOLUTION in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_FROM_BACKGROUND
constants.summary: Indicates the intent is coming from a background operation.
constants.description:
Bitwise-OR the constant with the Intent's flags property.

See Intent.FLAG_FROM_BACKGROUND in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_GRANT_READ_URI_PERMISSION
constants.summary: Grant read permission on the URI in the Intent's data or clipboard.
constants.description:
Bitwise-OR the constant with the Intent's flags property.

See Intent.FLAG_GRANT_READ_URI_PERMISSION in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_GRANT_WRITE_URI_PERMISSION
constants.summary: Grants write permission on the URI in the Intent's data or clipboard.
constants.description:
Bitwise-OR the constant with the Intent's flags property.

See Intent.FLAG_GRANT_WRITE_URI_PERMISSION in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_INSISTENT
constants.summary: Repeat audio until the notification is cancelled or the notification window is opened.
constants.description:
Use with flags.

See also: Notification.FLAG_INSISTENT in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_NO_CLEAR
constants.summary: Do not cancel the notification when the user clicks the Clear All button.
constants.description:
Use with flags.

See also: Notification.FLAG_NO_CLEAR in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_NO_CREATE
constants.summary: If the current intent does not exist, do not create it.
constants.description:
Use with the flags property.

See PendingIntent.FLAG_NO_CREATE in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_ONE_SHOT
constants.summary: The pending intent can only be used once.
constants.description:
Use with the flags property.

See PendingIntent.FLAG_ONE_SHOT in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_ONGOING_EVENT
constants.summary: Specifies that a notification is in reference to something that is ongoing, like a phone call.
constants.description:
Use with flags.

See also: Notification.FLAG_ONGOING_EVENT in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_ONLY_ALERT_ONCE
constants.summary: Play an alert (sound, lights, and/or vibration) once each time the notification is sent, even if it has not been canceled before that.
constants.description:
Use with flags.

See also: Notification.FLAG_ONLY_ALERT_ONCE in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_RECEIVER_REGISTERED_ONLY
constants.summary: When sending a broadcast, only registered receivers will be called.
constants.description:
Bitwise-OR the constant with the Intent's flags property.

See Intent.FLAG_RECEIVER_REGISTERED_ONLY in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_SHOW_LIGHTS
constants.summary: Use LED lights to alert the user to the notification.
constants.description:
Use with flags.

See also: Notification.FLAG_SHOW_LIGHTS in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: FLAG_UPDATE_CURRENT
constants.summary: If the current pending intent already exists, only update the current intent's extra data.
constants.description:
Use with the flags property.

See PendingIntent.FLAG_UPDATE_CURRENT in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: IMPORTANCE_DEFAULT
constants.summary: Used with Titanium.Android.NotificationChannel to specify an importance level.

constants.name: IMPORTANCE_HIGH
constants.summary: Used with Titanium.Android.NotificationChannel to specify an importance level.

constants.name: IMPORTANCE_LOW
constants.summary: Used with Titanium.Android.NotificationChannel to specify an importance level.

constants.name: IMPORTANCE_MAX
constants.summary: Used with Titanium.Android.NotificationChannel to specify an importance level.

constants.name: IMPORTANCE_MIN
constants.summary: Used with Titanium.Android.NotificationChannel to specify an importance level.

constants.name: IMPORTANCE_NONE
constants.summary: Used with Titanium.Android.NotificationChannel to specify an importance level.

constants.name: IMPORTANCE_UNSPECIFIED
constants.summary: Used with Titanium.Android.NotificationChannel to specify an importance level.

constants.name: NAVIGATION_MODE_STANDARD
constants.summary: Standard Action Bar navigation mode.
constants.description: Use with the navigationMode property. Note: NAVIGATION_MODE_STANDARD has been deprecated in API level 21 and up.

constants.name: NAVIGATION_MODE_TABS
constants.summary: Action Bar tab navigation mode.
constants.description: Use with the navigationMode property. Note: NAVIGATION_MODE_TABS has been deprecated in API level 21 and up.

constants.name: PENDING_INTENT_FOR_ACTIVITY
constants.summary: Not used.

constants.name: PENDING_INTENT_FOR_BROADCAST
constants.summary: Not used.

constants.name: PENDING_INTENT_FOR_SERVICE
constants.summary: Not used.

constants.name: PENDING_INTENT_MAX_VALUE
constants.summary: Not used.

constants.name: PRIORITY_DEFAULT
constants.summary: Default priority if it does not fit into another priority category.
constants.description:
Use with the priority property.

See also: Notification.PRIORITY_DEFAULT in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: PRIORITY_HIGH
constants.summary: Use for high priority notifications like real-time chat messages.
constants.description:
Use with the priority property.

See also: Notification.PRIORITY_HIGH in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: PRIORITY_LOW
constants.summary: Use for low priority notifications like software updates.
constants.description:
Use with the priority property.

See also: Notification.PRIORITY_LOW in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: PRIORITY_MAX
constants.summary: Use for urgent or time-critical notifications, for example, turn-by-turn directions or emergency alerts.
constants.description:
Use with the priority property.

See also: Notification.PRIORITY_MAX in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: PRIORITY_MIN
constants.summary: Use for expired events.
constants.description:
Use with the priority property.

Note that the user will not be alerted to the notification (sound, vibration, etc.), but the notification will appear in the drawer.

See also: Notification.PRIORITY_MIN in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: R
constants.summary: Accessor for Android system resources.

constants.name: RESULT_CANCELED
constants.summary: Used with setResult to specify that an activity was canceled.

constants.name: RESULT_FIRST_USER
constants.summary: Used with setResult to specify a user-defined result.
constants.description: User-defined result constants values start at RESULT_FIRST_USER.

constants.name: RESULT_OK
constants.summary: Used with setResult to specify that an activity succeeded.

constants.name: SCREEN_ORIENTATION_BEHIND
constants.summary: Use with requestedOrientation to specify the activity should run in the same orientation as the activity behind it in the activity stack.

constants.name: SCREEN_ORIENTATION_LANDSCAPE
constants.summary: Use with requestedOrientation to specify a landscape screen orientation.

constants.name: SCREEN_ORIENTATION_NOSENSOR
constants.summary: Use with requestedOrientation to specify that the sensor should be ignored and the display should not rotate.

constants.name: SCREEN_ORIENTATION_PORTRAIT
constants.summary: Use with requestedOrientation to specify a portrait screen orientation.

constants.name: SCREEN_ORIENTATION_SENSOR
constants.summary: Use with requestedOrientation to specify that orientation should be determined by the orientation sensor.

constants.name: SCREEN_ORIENTATION_UNSPECIFIED
constants.summary: Use with requestedOrientation to specify that the system should use its default rules for determining the best orientation.

constants.name: SCREEN_ORIENTATION_USER
constants.summary: Use with requestedOrientation to specify that the system should use the user's preferred orientation.

constants.name: SHOW_AS_ACTION_ALWAYS
constants.summary: Always show this item as an action button in the action bar.
constants.description: Use with the MenuItem's showAsAction property.

constants.name: SHOW_AS_ACTION_COLLAPSE_ACTION_VIEW
constants.summary: The action view can collapse to a normal menu item.
constants.description: Use with the MenuItem's showAsAction property.

constants.name: SHOW_AS_ACTION_IF_ROOM
constants.summary: Show this item as an action button if the system decides there is room for it.
constants.description: Use with the MenuItem's showAsAction property.

constants.name: SHOW_AS_ACTION_NEVER
constants.summary: Never display this item as an action button in the action bar.
constants.description: Use with the MenuItem's showAsAction property.

constants.name: SHOW_AS_ACTION_WITH_TEXT
constants.summary: When this item is in the action bar, always show it with a text label.
constants.description: Use with the MenuItem's showAsAction property.

constants.name: START_NOT_STICKY
constants.summary: A Service start mode indicating that if the host application is stopped by Android, the service should not be restarted automatically.
constants.description: Use as a startMode value in the options object passed to createServiceIntent.

constants.name: START_REDELIVER_INTENT
constants.summary: A Service start mode indicating that if the host application is stopped by Android, the service should be restarted automatically and the original Intent re-sent.
constants.description: Use as a startMode value in the options object passed to createServiceIntent.

constants.name: STREAM_ALARM
constants.summary: Use with audioStreamType to request that the alarm stream type for notifications be used.

constants.name: STREAM_DEFAULT
constants.summary: Use with audioStreamType to request that the default stream type for notifications be used.

constants.name: STREAM_MUSIC
constants.summary: Use with audioStreamType to request that the music stream type for notifications be used.

constants.name: STREAM_NOTIFICATION
constants.summary: Use with audioStreamType to request that the notification stream type for notifications be used.

constants.name: STREAM_RING
constants.summary: Use with audioStreamType to request that the ring stream type for notifications be used.

constants.name: STREAM_SYSTEM
constants.summary: Use with audioStreamType to request that the system stream type for notifications be used.

constants.name: STREAM_VOICE_CALL
constants.summary: Use with audioStreamType to request that the voice call stream type for notifications be used.

constants.name: TILE_STATE_ACTIVE
constants.summary: QuickSettings tile is active.
constants.description: The Tile is in enabled state and the user can interact with it.

constants.name: TILE_STATE_INACTIVE
constants.summary: QuickSettings tile is inactive.
constants.description: The Tile is in disabled state, but the user can interact with it.

constants.name: TILE_STATE_UNAVAILABLE
constants.summary: QuickSettings tile is unavailble.
constants.description: For some reason the Tile is not avaialable to the user and will have no click action.

constants.name: URI_INTENT_SCHEME
constants.summary: The URI scheme used for intent URIs.

constants.name: VISIBILITY_PRIVATE
constants.summary: Shows basic information about the notification.
constants.description:
Use with the visibility property.

Only the application name and icon appear in the lock screen with the message: "Contents hidden".

See also: Notification.VISIBILITY_PRIVATE in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: VISIBILITY_PUBLIC
constants.summary: Shows the notification's full content on the lockscreen. This is the system default if visibility is left unspecified.
constants.description:
Use with the visibility property.

See also: Notification.VISIBILITY_PUBLIC in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: VISIBILITY_SECRET
constants.summary: Shows the most minimal information of the notification on the lockscreen.
constants.description:
Use with the visibility property.

See also: Notification.VISIBILITY_SECRET in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: WAKE_LOCK_ACQUIRE_CAUSES_WAKEUP
constants.summary: Turn the screen on when the wake lock is acquired.
constants.description:
Use with the wakeLock property.

See also: PowerManager.ACQUIRE_CAUSES_WAKEUP in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: WAKE_LOCK_FULL
constants.summary: Ensures that the screen and keyboard backlight are on at full brightness.
constants.description:
Use with the wakeLock property.

See also: PowerManager.FULL_WAKE_LOCK in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: WAKE_LOCK_ON_AFTER_RELEASE
constants.summary: When this wake lock is released, poke the user activity timer so the screen stays on for a little longer.
constants.description:
Use with the wakeLock property.

See also: PowerManager.ON_AFTER_RELEASE in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: WAKE_LOCK_PARTIAL
constants.summary: Ensures that the CPU is running; the screen and keyboard backlight will be allowed to go off.
constants.description:
Use with the wakeLock property.

See also: PowerManager.PARTIAL_WAKE_LOCK in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: WAKE_LOCK_SCREEN_BRIGHT
constants.summary: Ensures that the screen is on at full brightness; the keyboard backlight will be allowed to go off.
constants.description:
Use with the wakeLock property.

See also: PowerManager.SCREEN_BRIGHT_WAKE_LOCK in the Android API Reference.

constants.name: WAKE_LOCK_SCREEN_DIM
constants.summary: Ensures that the screen is on (but may be dimmed); the keyboard backlight will be allowed to go off.
constants.description:
Use with the wakeLock property.

See also: PowerManager.SCREEN_DIM_WAKE_LOCK in the Android API Reference.
